revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=D-Link |model=DNS-120 |revision=A2 |upc=790069270666 |ean= |asin=B0002Z45J0;US; |price= |est_release_date=04/2005 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=Cellvision |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=NAS |fcc_id= |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=2.1 |pwr_barrel_len=9.5 |cpu1_brand=ADMtek |cpu1_model=ADM5120 |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=S29GL032M90TAIR4 |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=ESMT |ram1_model=M12L128168A-7T |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag=yes,, 14-pin header,, unpopulated,, |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, internal,, unpopulated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200,8,N,1),, |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=USB 2.0 Controller;NEC;µPD720101;NEC, JAPAN, D720101GJ, 0509PPA51;1; ,,, 5A Low Dropout Positive Voltage Regulator;AME;AME1084;;1; ,,, 1.5A CMOS LDO;AME;AME8815;;1; |flags= |stock_boot=ADMBoot; |stock_os=Linux;2.4.18;5120-05; |tp_firmware=OpenWrt, |default_ip=192.168.0.101 |default_user=admin |default_pass=blank |oui_eth=00:11:95, 00:15:E9 }} {{TagLine|Network Storage Adapter}} :{{SupportPage|vendor=D-Link|model=DNS-120|vs_id=352}} "EPFS202UA020" and "FS202WU-1B0" is silkscreened on the board. :A date code of '''0517''' (April 2005) is also on the board. This device would seem to be a [http://web.archive.org/web/20060116103529/http://www.cellvision.net/product/file_server.htm '''Cellvision''' FS-202U] :(the FS-202WU [wireless capable] probably shared the same board). This device is listed on the [http://www.linux-mips.org/wiki/Adm5120_devices ''linux-mips'' ADM5120 device list]. In the absense of a DHCP server, the device will assume the IP of 192.168.0.101. ===Serial=== ====Pinout==== 
  °     °     °     °
(3.3) (TxD) (RxD) (GND) JP2

<--- LED ---> Screw + Board RSide edge
===Recovery via ADM Boot=== Hit the spacebar three times quickly after power-on - you can then transfer :a desired file to flash via [[wikipedia:XMODEM|XMODEM]] ([http://ttssh2.sourceforge.jp/ '''Tera Term'''] will work fine if you're :in [or have] a Windows environment to work with). [http://sitecom.nas-central.org/wiki/OpenWrt_on_the_LN-350] [http://www.nomissoft.com/files/cam_revival.pdf] [http://flyrouter.net/doku.php?id=midge:howto_5120] A successful recovery should look something like the following.. 
ADM Bootloader (v0.04.01 20040216)
==================================
(a) Download vmlinuz to flash ...
(b) Download vmlinuz to sdram (for debug) ...
(c) Update bootloader ...
(e) Exit

Please enter your key : a
Downloading..........PASS

Eraseing flash.......PASS

Programming flash....PASS
==Images== File:D-Link DNS-120 rev A1 board top.jpg|board top File:D-Link DNS-120 rev A1 board bot.jpg|board bottom [[Has images::internal| ]] __NOTOC__
